alert.note: Alert for Coastal York; Interior York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 2:57PM EST until February 23 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...LOW PRESSURE TO BRING SNOW AND MIXED PRECIPITATION TO THE REGION TONIGHT AND THURSDAY... .Low pressure will move across southern New England late tonight and Thursday. Snow is expected to overspread the area from west to east tonight and may be heavy at times overnight into early Thursday morning. Sleet may mix in late tonight and Thursday morning, mainly across southern New Hampshire. Another period of snow may occur Thursday night into Friday with more minor accumulations possible. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and sleet expected. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 9 inches and sleet accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Maine. Portions of central and northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 7 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Periods of moderate and heavy snow will combine with low visibility to create dangerous driving conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
